Generate simulation times and the indices of time points to return in simulation functions.

Source: R/utils.R
dot-simulationTimes.Rd

Generate simulation times and the indices of time points to return in simulation functions.

Usage

.simulationTimes(t_start = 0, t_end = 1000, t_step = 0.1, t_store = 1000)

Arguments

t_start

Numeric scalar. Indicates the initial time of the simulation. (Default: 0)

t_end

Numeric scalar. Indicates the final time of the simulation (Default: 1000)

t_step

Numeric scalar. Indicates the interval between simulation steps (Default: 0.1)

t_store

Integer scalar. Indicates the number of evenly distributed time points to keep (Default: 100)

Value

lists containing simulation times (t_sys) and the indices to keep.

Examples

Time <- .simulationTimes(
    t_start = 0, t_end = 100, t_step = 0.5,
    t_store = 100
)
DefaultTime <- .simulationTimes(t_end = 1000)
